mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: Rector and Visitors of the University of Virginia
mdRecord.dcterms:description: ... initially designed to be offices of the French state. The building that would become the Hôtel de Crillon was first occupied by Louis Marie Augustin, Duke of Aurmont, a famous patron of the arts. The building was further enhanced by its second owner, the architect Louis-François Trouard. Adapted as a hotel, 1909. -- https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/H%C3%B4tel_de_Crillon [work]
